abstract: Robert D. Novak, the writer who first named a C.I.A. spy, has remained on the sidelines of a game he started.
snippet: Robert D. Novak, the writer who first named a C.I.A. spy, has remained on the sidelines of a game he started.
lead_paragraph: Last week was a busy one for the journalists caught up in the Valerie Plame saga three years ago. The trial of I. Lewis Libby, the former chief of staff to Vice President Dick Cheney, included the less than appetizing spectacle of watching experienced reporters explain precisely how the job gets done.

headline.main: Skipping Merrily Along as Others Take the Heat
headline.print_headline: Skipping Merrily Along As Others Take the Heat

abstract: Credit Suisse said Monday that it hired Michael D. Ryan, a former managing director at Goldman Sachs, as head of securities for its investment banking division. Mr. Ryan will join Credit Suisse’s New York office some time “midyear,” Credit Suisse said. He will oversee Credit Suisse’s global securities businesses and serve on the management committee of its investment banking group. At Goldman Sachs, Mr. Ryan had been co-head of global equities.
lead_paragraph: Credit Suisse said Monday that it hired Michael D. Ryan, a former managing director at Goldman Sachs, as head of securities for its investment banking division. Mr. Ryan will join Credit Suisse’s New York office some time “midyear,” Credit Suisse said. He will oversee Credit Suisse’s global securities businesses and serve on the management committee of its investment banking group. At Goldman Sachs, Mr. Ryan had been co-head of global equities.

headline.main: Revolving Door: Credit Suisse, C.E. Unterberg
